resource.name: 2022 Municipal Census - Enumeration Areas
resource.description:
Table representing household census data aggregated to Enumeration Area (EA) gathered in the 2022 Municipal Census. 
The municipal census was conducted in the spring of 2022. The census gathers information such as the number of people who live in the home, their ages and gender; the type of dwelling; and length of residency in Strathcona County. An up-to-date census count ensures the County receives the maximum grant dollars based on population. These dollars go toward municipal programs such as roads, transit, and community and family services. Census information is also used to plan for future services and programs.
The GIS Branch may use the household data for analysis; however, areas containing less than 50 people will not be reported. This practice is in line with Statistics Canada reporting. The data is not available directly to Strathcona County staff but is available upon request and permission from LLS. The data is not shared publicly at the household level.

resource.name: 2016 Priority Based Budgeting Programs
resource.description:
As part of the Priority Based Budgeting methodology, Strathcona County has identified 315 unique business programs that describe the services provided to the public. These defined programs are prioritized through a corporate evaluation, which influences the funding allocation.

As Strathcona County continues to implement priority based budgeting, programs and program descriptions will be continually looked at for refinements and improvements to best reflect the services that departments provides, both externally (to residents) and internally (to the organization).

http://www.strathcona.ca/departments/corporate-planning/priority-based-business-planning-budgeting/pbb-programs/
columns_description: Unique program identification
Brief description of program
Quartile is a quantifiable representation of how well the program aligns to the delivery of corporate strategies and goals.
Strathcona County work unit
Unique program name

resource.name: Priority Environment Management Units
resource.description:
This data represents Priority Environment Management Areas within Strathcona County. This data is intended to be used with Land Use planning.

Strathcona County supports cooperative efforts to ensure the quality of water, land, air and natural resources found within the region are maintained and enhanced. Priority environment management areas (PEMA) have been identified to aid the County in meeting the environment management objectives. The data displays buffers that have been created to protect lands and water resources as well as unique habitats. Data is static. It was collected around 2007 for the MDP report that year.

resource.name: 2012 Municipal Census - County Totals
resource.description: This is the content from the Municipal Census 2012 EA Dataset that has been summed up by each measure and transposed in order to create visuals.

resource.name: 2017 Election Results
resource.description: Election results for the 2017 Strathcona County municipal elections. Results include all positions and all voting stations.

resource.name: Outdoor Rinks
resource.description: “Outdoor Rinks" are outdoor areas of land designed to facilitate skating activities in the winter and general recreation in other seasons that are owned or maintained by Strathcona County. These areas are outdoor rinks but may not have permanent walls and/or can also allow general recreation. It includes the bounds of the area as designated by Strathcona County and are always within a 'Park'. These include permanent rinks and seasonal rinks (on grass or ice).

resource.name: Building Permits
resource.description: Building permits from January 1, 1997 to present. This dataset complies with the Building & Land Development Specification (BLDS) standard for sharing open data on building and construction permits issued by municipal governments. For more information on the BLDS specification see http://permitdata.org/

resource.name: 2019 Property Tax Assessment

Strathcona County does not warrant, or guarantee the accuracy of this information. The County does not assume nor accept any liability from the use of the information.

resource.name: 2013 Satisfaction Survey
resource.description:
The individual results from the Strathcona County Public Satisfaction Survey completed in December 2013.  A summary of these results can be found at http://www.strathcona.ca/departments/communications/public-satisfaction-survey-results/

Additionally, the codes for each answer are listed in the attached document.
